channel.title: Chinese Currency Manipulation
channel.description:
You may hear in the news about how China is manipulating the RMB or how Obama's proposal for regulations on currency trade with china was rejected by the G-20 members. So I've decided to make a thread about it and voice my opinion.
First of all a little background: The U.S. claims China is manipulating its currency by buying American bonds, this in return inflates the American dollar, while keeping the Yuan low. Why is this good? Because this takes advantage of the low-cost of the service sector in China, and makes exports look more attractive.
As a result, the U.S. claims that jobs are shipped from the U.S. straight to China, and that's why the whole entire world should gang up on China, probably bankrupting the whole entire country. The problem with this theory is that the jobs were never in the U.S. In the United States corporations have already developed hi-tech machinery that can do the job better than any american worker. And simply stiff-arming China isn't going to fix the problem of out-sourcing, corporations will just move to other developing countries like India, Vietnam, Indonesia, and Brazil.
Not to mention, the U.S. just printed $600 billion dollars that's obviously some form of currency manipulation don't you think.
Sorry guys, this is the price of Capitalism, survival of the fittest. When we signed the constitution and laid down the stepping stones of what would become the free-market, we acknowledged that one day we would have to compete with other nations.
What the Obama administration is doing makes me sick. They have analysts that have a far more broad understanding of this than a 14-year old kid in highschool, but all he cares about is getting re-elected. He finally hit a topic that both republicans and democrats agree on and is taking advantage of the close-mindedness of the country. He needs to accept that he isn't getting re-elected and go back to trying to fix the economy. I mean seriously his approval ratings are lower than George Bush's were during his second term.

item.title: Chinese Currency Manipulation
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:17, topic:368908”][quote author=ChaosPkers link=topic=465044.msg3400712#msg3400712 date=1289883638]

[quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=465044.msg3400710#msg3400710 date=1289883243]

Coon there is no NEW jobs for people, Last time I check at least.

That’s why there was a new store opened up less than 10 miles from my home? I was hired in temporarily to help setup. Also, my Dad’s friend James opened up a Sprint store about 15 minutes from my house, did I get hired? No, but that was because I waited too long to put in an application.

Please, the country didn’t come to a complete stop.

Never said it did, but it has turned around. Jobs are JUST starting to increase in some area’s. My old town in Mississippi is doing better than ever. This town im currently in is now recovering. Some old towns around me, for example, Pontiac, are getting back. I am not saying the entire nation is like this, I am just saying, the nation is starting to turn, if not already.
[/quote]its terrible where i live/around me. so, maybe ur just a special guy…

Look at states of your area during different times. It has changed, it cant be just ‘terrible’ unless it never changed and has always been that way.
[/quote]god… no shit… …

You stated it as if your area has always been terrible and never changed. I wouldn’t need to make obvious statements if you would make actual descriptions.[/quote]nobody likes literal people

Read full topic

Obama is only trying to protect his ass, not caring where he is headed, as long as he gets there safely.

I do approve of few things Obama has done, but as for jobs, I see more of those popping up around me these days. As for the oil spill, that was not Obama’s fault, that was BP trying to save a bit of money and not going the maintenance like they should have.
